projects.name: Personal Profile Page
projects.description: In this first Treehouse Techdegree project I created a personal project page with the use of HTML and CSS. A default design was given and I customized it to my personal taste.

projects.name: Responsive Layout
projects.description: In this project, I built a responsive and mobile-first page from scratch using HTML and CSS. Mockups for three breakpoints were given, including a HTML5 <nav> element to navigate between the different sections of the page.

projects.name: Online Registration Form
projects.description: In this project, I built a responsive, mobile-friendly registration form using HTML forms and of course CSS. In addition to the mockup, I added HTML5 validation and placeholder text as well as CSS transitions

projects.name: Photo Gallery
projects.description: This was the first project in which JavaScript was used. With the help of a jQuery plugin I built an interactive photo gallery which allowed the user to switch between images in a light box. Additionally, there was a search box so the user could search the image descriptions.

projects.name: CSS to SASS
projects.description: The starting point for this project was the code from the Responsive Layout project. The task was to refactor the styles using SCSS partials, variables, extends, and mixins

projects.name: SVG site update
projects.description: In this project, a website with PNG images was to be refactored using SVG files. I've added hover states to some of the SVGs and changed the colors of others.

projects.name: Game Show App
projects.description: This was the first project in which JavaScript was used without the help of plugins. It was a version of Wheel of Success in which the user clicks letters to guess a given phrase. If he chooses incorrectly more than five times, the game is over and he can start again.

projects.name: Webapp Dashboard
projects.description: In this project, I built a dashboard with the help of a chart library called chart.js. It had some interacrive elements and local storage was used. For the basic layout I chose CSS Grid.

projects.name: Employee Directory
projects.description: In this project, I built an employee directory using JavaScript and public API. The API provided random user data and the website displays them and allows the user to search for names and user names.

projects.name: React Image Gallery
projects.description: In this project, I built an image gallery using React and the Flickr API. The user could either navigate through the given topics or search for a certain key word.
